question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [LRU ordering determinism] Is the LRU eviction order deterministic given the same transaction execution order, or can internal LRU implementation details cause non-deterministic evictions across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Static: VERIFIED_MODULES_CACHE] [Cache initialization determinism] Does the global cache initialize identically across all validator nodes at genesis or after restarts, or can initialization timing differences cause divergent cache states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: verifier_cache_enabled()] [Feature flag consistency] If the disable_verifier_cache feature is compiled differently across validator nodes, can this cause fundamental execution behavior differences where some nodes cache and others don't? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Struct: VerifiedModuleCache] [Mutex poisoning] If a thread panics while holding the Mutex lock in contains(), put(), or flush(), does the Mutex become poisoned, and can this cause all subsequent cache operations to fail, breaking verification for the entire validator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Lock panic handling] If the lock().get() operation panics due to LRU cache internal errors, is the panic handled gracefully, or can it propagate and crash the validator during block execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Struct: VerifiedModuleCache] [Unsafe code interaction] Does the lru::LruCache crate use any unsafe code internally that could cause undefined behavior, memory corruption, or security vulnerabilities when storing module hashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Drop implementation] If VerifiedModuleCache is dropped (e.g., during validator shutdown), does the Mutex and LRU cache properly clean up without leaking resources or causing use-after-free? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: size()] [Integer overflow in size()] Could the usize returned by len() overflow when converted to other integer types in calling code, potentially causing incorrect cache size checks or metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Caller assumption] Do callers of contains() correctly handle the race condition where contains() returns false, verification begins, but another thread completes verification and calls put() first, potentially causing duplicate verification work? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Error handling] If put() is called after verification completes but the module actually failed verification, can this incorrect usage poison the cache and allow unverified modules to execute? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Hash computation mismatch] If the module hash computation in the caller differs from the hash used in put(), can contains() miss cached entries, causing unnecessary re-verification and performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Verification bypass] If code paths call put() without actually performing verification (e.g., due to bugs in error handling), can this cache unverified modules and create a complete verification bypass vulnerability? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: flush()] [Coordination with other caches] When flush() is called, are related caches (e.g., compiled module cache, type cache) also flushed consistently, or can cache coherence issues arise from partial cache invalidation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: verifier_cache_enabled()] [Test mode bypass] When disable_verifier_cache feature is enabled for testing, does this completely disable caching as intended, or can edge cases still cache entries causing test pollution? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Test determinism] With disable_verifier_cache enabled, does contains() always return false deterministically, or can implementation details cause non-deterministic test behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Test isolation] When disable_verifier_cache is enabled, does put() become a no-op that prevents cache pollution across test runs, or can test state leak between tests? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: verifier_cache_enabled()] [Feature flag security] Can the disable_verifier_cache feature flag be exploited in production builds to disable caching and cause verification DoS by forcing all modules to re-verify? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: verifier_cache_enabled()] [cfg_if macro safety] Does the cfg_if macro correctly evaluate feature flags at compile time without runtime overhead, or can macro expansion bugs cause incorrect cache behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Side channel attacks] Can an attacker measure timing differences in contains() + verification vs contains() hit to leak information about which modules are cached on validator nodes, enabling cache timing side channels? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Selective caching attack] Can an attacker strategically deploy many modules to fill the cache with their modules, then exploit the fact that victim modules are evicted and must re-verify, creating asymmetric performance advantages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Static: VERIFIED_MODULES_CACHE] [Cache warmup attack] Can an attacker observe validator startup patterns and pre-deploy modules that will be cached during warmup, ensuring their malicious modules are cached while legitimate modules must verify repeatedly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Cache probing] Can an attacker submit transactions that probe the cache state by measuring execution time variations, learning which modules are cached to infer validator activity patterns or state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: flush()] [Flush amplification] Can an attacker trigger repeated cache flushes through governance proposals or verifier config changes, forcing validators to continuously re-verify all modules and degrading network performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Publishing race condition] During module publishing, if multiple transactions try to publish different versions of the same module concurrently, can cache state become inconsistent with which version was actually published? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Module overwrite] If a module is upgraded to a new version with identical bytecode (same hash), does contains() incorrectly return true causing the upgrade verification to be skipped? (Medium)
